result.execSummary:
Terrence R McCarville was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrence R McCarville is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:51 am Defendant in court with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court and parties discuss new information. Court take break at 9:01 am for Defense to review evidence. Court back on the record at 9:04 am. Court and parties address jury instructions. 

Jury present at 9:10 am. Oath given to final jury panel. Court reads preliminary jury instructions. Opening statement by ADA Lazarus. Opening statement by Attorney Welch. Sidebar at 9:36 am. Sidebar ends at 9:38 am. 

States Case:

G.M. duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by State. Witness IDs defendant. Cross exam by the Defense. Witness excused and released from subpoena. 

W.M. duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by the State. Sidebar at 10:28 am. Sidebar ends at 10:28 am. Direct exam by the State continues. Witness IDs defendant. Cross exam by the Defense. 

Jury break at 10:44 am.
On the record at 11:07 am. 
Jury present at 11:11 am

W.M. on the stand. Direct exam by the state continues. Exhibit 1 marked for ID, offered and received. Cross exam by the Defense. Sidebar at 11:38 am. Sidebar ends at 11:41 am.

Jury lunch at 11:41 am

Outside of the Jury presence. Witness W.M. excused. Parties discuss testimony and possibility of Brady Violation. Defense makes Motion for Mistrial. Court denies Motion for reasons stated on the record. Court discusses additional jury instruction. Court break at 11:58 am

Jury present at 12:39 pm

W.M. on the stand. Cross exam by the Defense continues. Exhibit 2 marked for ID, offered and received. Witness excused and released from subpoena.

J.C. sworn and testified. Direct exam by the State. Cross exam by the Defense. Redirect by the State. Witness excused and released from subpoena. Exhibit 3 marked for identification purposes, offered and received. Sidebar at 1:29 pm. Sidebar ends at 1:30 pm. State rests. 

Jury break at 1:31 pm.

Outside of the jury presence. Court colloquy with defendant regarding right to testify. Defendant elects to testify. 

Jury present at 1:34 pm

Defense case:

Defendant T.M. sworn and testified. Direct exam by the Defense. Cross exam by the State. Redirect by the Defense. Witness excused.

Defense rests. 

Jury break at 2:01 pm.

Outside of jury presence parties discuss final jury instructions. 

Jury present at 2:37 pm. Court reads jury instructions. Closing argument by ADA Lazarus. Sidebar at 3:03 pm. Sidebar ends at 3:04 pm. Closing arguments by ADA Lazarus continues. Closing argument by Attorney Welch. Rebuttal by ADA Lazarus. Alternate Jurors  #4 A.B. and #6 A.R. chosen. Remaining closing instructions read by the Court. Bailiff sworn. Deliberations begin at 3:46 pm.

Jury Question #1 at 5:44 pm. Court on the record at 5:48 pm. Parties discuss Jury Question #1. Court sends response to Jury Question #1 at 5:49 pm.

Verdict at 6:29 pm. Jury present at 6:39 pm

Verdict: Count 1  Not Guilty   Count 2  Not Guilty

Jury excused at 6:41 pm

Defense moves for Judgment of Acquittal, no objection. Defendant released. Case Dismissed.
Final
Prospective

08:38 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  William Leroy Brown and Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests set over for reasons stated on the record. Attorney Welch makes statement in objection to set over. Defense makes Motion to dismiss case with prejudice. Court denies motion for reasons stated on the record.

Judge and parties discuss trial mechanics and scheduling and any motions.

9:27 am Prospective Jury Panel present and duly sworn. Voir Dire by the Court. Voir Dire by the State. Sidebar at 9:57 am. Sidebar ends at 9:58 am. Voir Dire by the Defense. Sidebar at 10:18 am. Sidebar ends at 10:18 am. Voir Dire by the Defense continues. Jurors in the gallery excused at 10:23 am. Parties exercise strikes. Jurors not chosen excused at 10:30 am. Final panel excused at 10:34 am. Court break at 10:35 am. On the record at 10:47 am.

Motions in Limine argued. Court adjourned at 10:59 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State gives last best offer; Defn wishes to proceed to trial.
